result.execSummary:
The defendant David O Jerovitz Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $100 fine plus costs have been paid in full.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David O Jerovitz Jr.

defendant.name: Jerovitz, David O, Jr.
defendant.address: 441 S Fulton Av, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant David O Jerovitz in court. Raymond L. Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant advises that he paid amounts due last week. State makes recommendation. Court imposes fine and costs.

Defendant David O Jerovitz in court. Joan M Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to amend Count 1 to possession of THC. Court questions Defendant on continued waiver of right to Counsel . Court reviews max. penalties, elements.  Defendant enters no contest plea to amended charge.  Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty of amended Count 1. State advises of offer that would allow Defendant to avoid probation, requests 90 day adjournment. Bond continues as is. Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 29, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only in the amount and frequency prescribed. To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving Justice Center.

Defendant David O Jerovitz in court.  Joan M Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charge, max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim. Defendant wants to try to resolve matter with DA, waives right to Counsel. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver. Defendant to make appointment with DA.  Bond set.  Status conference scheduled for June 26, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
